p: This section highlights key management and research issues that need to be addressed to improve Prosopis control and the factors that currently constrain progress in these areas (Fig.Â 7). There is a great need for countries to develop national and even regional strategies, to provide guidelines for research and management in a targeted way, as each country has unique requirements and needs. Australia and Ascension Island are the only counties/territories to have strategic plans for Prosopis management and countries with long-standing Prosopis control programmes such as South Africa and Kenya still do not .
